meanings.definition: Pledge as security without delivery of title or possession.
meanings.sent1: The hypothecates were valuable items given as security for the loan.
meanings.sent2: The bank accepted the hypothecates in exchange for the loan.
meanings.sent3: The hypothecates decided to throw a party to celebrate their new role as security.
meanings.sent4: The hypothecates stood guard, protecting the loan like loyal soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The glittering hypothecates caught the eye of anyone who passed by.

meanings.sent1: She hypothecates her jewelry to borrow money in times of need.
meanings.sent2: He hypothecates his car to secure a loan for his business.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel hypothecates its acorns for a chance to win the nut lottery.
meanings.sent4: The sun hypothecates its warmth to the earth, ensuring life thrives.
meanings.sent5: The student hypothecates his future success on his dedication to studying.
